channel.title: 3d (software) egnine! Image heavy
channel.description:
So Taharok finally let me reveal our latest project, so instead of boring text, we'll do pictures first! Hes working on it right now so I went through the tools and scouted out some pictures.
[center][size=18pt][b]Behind the scenes - progress images[/b][/size][/center]
Engine beginning: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qsv9WWOhULU More videos: http://img69.imageshack.us/g/9hd.mp4/
[img]http://img684.imageshack.us/img684/2391/shadesphere3.png[/img] [img]http://img22.imageshack.us/img22/7231/goblini.png[/img] [img]http://img707.imageshack.us/img707/8991/multitextures.png[/img] [img]http://img691.imageshack.us/img691/3134/landscapeearly.png[/img] [img]http://img813.imageshack.us/img813/7756/heightmapoutward.png[/img] [img]http://img21.imageshack.us/img21/706/blend1k.png[/img] [img]http://img534.imageshack.us/img534/7301/grassylandscape.png[/img]
[center][size=18pt][b]Animator/Object viewer[/b][/size][/center] [img]http://img26.imageshack.us/img26/1932/47080024.png[/img] [img]http://img189.imageshack.us/img189/2496/78008430.png[/img] [img]http://img689.imageshack.us/img689/8990/71724170.png[/img] [img]http://img848.imageshack.us/img848/5743/75940880.png[/img] [img]http://img171.imageshack.us/img171/572/29193207.png[/img]
[center][size=18pt][b]World editor (released today)[/b][/size][/center] [img]http://img193.imageshack.us/img193/1710/73901033.png[/img] [img]http://img848.imageshack.us/img848/38/34025303.png[/img] [img]http://img268.imageshack.us/img268/8581/19771570.png[/img] [img]http://img3.imageshack.us/img3/7940/80984604.png[/img] [img]http://img26.imageshack.us/img26/7469/88087587.png[/img] [img]http://img5.imageshack.us/img5/1958/18569030.png[/img] [img]http://img219.imageshack.us/img219/6393/28677231.png[/img] [img]http://img203.imageshack.us/img203/2736/91122656.png[/img] [img]http://img810.imageshack.us/img810/182/mandersmessage.png[/img]
World editor (released today)
Taharok and I have been working on this engine since January (3 months), in our everlasting quest to create an actual game, we're now closer than ever and still have a ton of shit to do. I didn't help with any of the programming or anything, I mainly helped design the tools and systems to fit to how I work, so I can work. [u][b] Right now we have:[/b][/u] Animator Joints Bones - "Limbs" Frames Timeline Object viewer Light Shadows UV support Texturing World editor Terrain sculpting Terrain Painting First person controller preview Ambient lighting Diffuse/lambertian reflectance zbuffering AA

item.title: 3d (software) egnine! Image heavy
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

Indeed, and you could always use the OpenGL-based pipeline for better performance (some operations will be hardware accelerated). Use “-Dsun.java2d.opengl=true” on the command line for silent enablement.

By the way, it looks nice so far!

Read full topic

item.title: 3d (software) egnine! Image heavy
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

software rendering is a much more interesting learning exercise

Read full topic

item.title: 3d (software) egnine! Image heavy
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

frank_:

how much of jagexs code does it use

None. The majority of the code was written by me, some parts were based on code written by ^ when he was doing his triangle algorithms, and a few other parts are based on online resources. A lot of the game engine code is based on the game engine I wrote last summer, but all of the 3d stuff is basically new.

Read full topic

item.title: 3d (software) egnine! Image heavy
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

if the software is properly written, the actual graphics engine is decoupled from the application domain and thus switching from using one renderer to another would take nothing but the implementation of a specific set of virtual definitions

although this engine does look pretty neat, tell taharok to stop being a fag and switch to ogl

Read full topic

item.title: 3d (software) egnine! Image heavy
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Hands up

He said it, not me. I wanted OpenGL from the start because it was better for supporting my art. At first I think he was only doing it for experience and never expected to push it, but hes still talking about switching over to opengl so most of this probably isn’t useless.

Read full topic

item.title: 3d (software) egnine! Image heavy
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’m sorry, but as Unhandled said both reasons you stated are complete bullshit. Not using OpenGL is never a good idea for a 3d game, not only is it hardware accelerated on just about anything, even if it isn’t the software implementation is certainly better than anything you guys can come up with. I’m not saying what you are doing is bad, it’s just never going to be as good as OpenGL.

Read full topic

item.title: 3d (software) egnine! Image heavy
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Frell:

I wanted it to be OGL from the start but apparently itd take longer for him to learn everything in OGL and ‘supposedly’ a custom software engine is more flexible.

both of those things sound like bullshit to me.

you don’t even need know much 3d math to use ogl, and shaders allow the gpu to be entirely as flexible with the added benefit of being orders of magnitude more efficient.

Read full topic

item.title: 3d (software) egnine! Image heavy
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:16, topic:388811”]what kind of framerates do you get on those terrains?

ps software rendering is pretty pointless these days.[/quote]
On my computer they’re pretty fine but not on Taharoks.

I wanted it to be OGL from the start but apparently itd take longer for him to learn everything in OGL and ‘supposedly’ a custom software engine is more flexible.

Read full topic

item.title: 3d (software) egnine! Image heavy
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

super_:

taharok has been working on an engine for years

Constantly starting over usually though

Moparisthebest:

Looks really good so far, are you planning on releasing any of this in the future? (also, opengl hopefully?)

I doubt the releasing part, but Taharok did mention wanting to go to opengl eventually.

[quote=“Newty, post:12, topic:388811”]Looks awesome.

You said you two plan on creating your own game. Do you have any ideas as to what it is going to be? Or are you focused completely on finishing the engine before any thought is given to the game?[/quote]
First person medieval is an idea we’re throwing around right now. Our goal quality wise is to land between WoW and SW Runescape.

Read full topic

Looks really good so far, are you planning on releasing any of this in the future? (also, opengl hopefully?)

They could be using OpenGL, DirectX, or (hopefully not) implementing their own software engine. That is what I’m asking and the title doesn’t clarify.
